tool.name: MSFraggerAdapter
tool.description:
Peptide Identification with MSFragger. Important note: The Regents of the University of Michigan (“Michigan”) grants us permission to redistribute the MS Fragger application developed by Michigan within the OpenMS Pipeline and make available for use on related service offerings supported by the University of Tubingen and the Center for Integrative Bioinformatics. Per the license agreement the use of the pipeline and associated materials is for academic research, non-commercial or educational purposes. Any commercial use inquiries must be directed to the University of Michigan Technology Transfer Office at techtransfer@umich.edu. All right title and interest in MS Fragger shall remain with the University of Michigan.
For details, please see the supplied license file or https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenMS/THIRDPARTY/master/All/MSFragger/License.txt
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out && #if "opt_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir opt_out && #end if mkdir database && ln -s '$database' 'database/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $database.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($database.ext)' &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' #if "opt_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -opt_out 'opt_out/output.${gxy2omsext("pepxml")}' #end if -database 'database/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $database.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($database.ext)' #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("idxml")}' '$out' #if "opt_out_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'opt_out/output.${gxy2omsext("pepxml")}' '$opt_out' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Set to yes, if you have read and agreed to the MSFragger license terms
Maximum Java heap size (in MB)
Input File with specta for MSFragge
param.help: select mzml,mzxml data sets(s)

param.label: Protein FASTA database file path
param.help: select fasta data sets(s)

param.label: Recalculate peptide to protein association using OpenMS
param.help: Annotates target-decoy information

param.name: precursor_mass_tolerance_lower
param.label: Lower precursor mass tolerance

param.name: precursor_mass_tolerance_upper
param.label: Upper precursor mass tolerance

param.name: precursor_mass_unit
param.label: Unit of precursor mass tolerance

param.name: precursor_true_tolerance
param.label: True precursor mass tolerance (window is +/- this value)
param.help: Used for tie breaker of results (in spectrally ambiguous cases) and zero bin boosting in open searches (0 disables these features). This option is STRONGLY recommended for open searches

param.name: precursor_true_unit
param.label: Unit of precursor true tolerance

param.name: fragment_mass_tolerance
param.label: Fragment mass tolerance (window is +/- this value)

param.name: fragment_mass_unit
param.label: Unit of fragment mass tolerance

param.name: isotope_error
param.label: Isotope correction for MS/MS events triggered on isotopic peaks
param.help: Should be set to 0 (disabled) for open search or 0/1/2 for correction of narrow window searches. Shifts the precursor mass window to multiples of this value multiplied by the mass of C13-C12

param.name: search_enzyme_name
param.label: Name of the enzyme to be written to the pepXML file

param.name: search_enzyme_cutafter
param.label: Residues after which the enzyme cuts (specified as a string of amino acids)

param.name: search_enzyme_nocutbefore
param.label: Residues that the enzyme will not cut before

param.name: num_enzyme_termini
param.label: Number of enzyme termini (non-enzymatic (0), semi (1), fully (2)

param.name: allowed_missed_cleavage
param.label: Allowed number of missed cleavages

param.name: min_length
param.label: Minimum length of peptides to be generated during in-silico digestion

param.name: max_length
param.label: Maximum length of peptides to be generated during in-silico digestion

param.name: mass_range_min
param.label: Min mass of peptides to be generated (Da)

param.name: mass_range_max
param.label: Max mass of peptides to be generated (Da)

param.name: clip_nterm_m
param.label: Specifies the trimming of a protein N-terminal methionine as a variable modification

param.name: masses
param.label: Masses for variable modifications
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: syntaxes
param.label: Syntax Strings for variable modifications
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: unimod
param.label: Variable modifications in unimod syntax, is added to mass+syntax varmod list
param.help: (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: enable_common
param.label: Enable common variable modifications (15.9949 M and 42.0106 [^)

param.name: not_allow_multiple_variable_mods_on_residue
param.label: Do not allow any one amino acid to be modified by multiple variable modifications

param.name: max_variable_mods_per_peptide
param.label: Maximum total number of variable modifications per peptide

param.name: max_variable_mods_combinations
param.label: Maximum allowed number of modified variably modified peptides from each peptide sequence, (maximum of 65534)
param.help: If a greater number than the maximum is generated, only the unmodified peptide is considered

param.name: minimum_peaks
param.label: Minimum number of peaks in experimental spectrum for matching

param.name: use_topn_peaks
param.label: Pre-process experimental spectrum to only use top N peaks

param.name: minimum_ratio
param.label: Filters out all peaks in experimental spectrum less intense than this multiple of the base peak intensity

param.name: clear_mz_range_min
param.label: Removes peaks in this m/z range prior to matching (minimum value)
param.help: Useful for iTRAQ/TMT experiments (i.e. 0.0 150.0)

param.name: clear_mz_range_max
param.label: Removes peaks in this m/z range prior to matching (maximum value)
param.help: Useful for iTRAQ/TMT experiments (i.e. 0.0 150.0)

param.name: max_fragment_charge
param.label: Maximum charge state for theoretical fragments to match

param.name: override_charge
param.label: Ignores precursor charge and uses charge state specified in precursor_charge range (parameters: spectrum:precursor_charge_min and spectrum:precursor_charge_max)

param.name: precursor_charge_min
param.label: Min charge of precursor charge range to conside
param.help: If specified, also spectrum:override_charge must be set)

param.name: precursor_charge_max
param.label: Max charge of precursor charge range to conside
param.help: If specified, also spectrum:override_charge must be set)

param.name: track_zero_topn
param.label: Track top N unmodified peptide results separately from main results internally for boosting features
param.help: Should be set to a number greater than search:output_report_topN if zero bin boosting is desired

param.name: zero_bin_accept_expect
param.label: Ranks a zero-bin hit above all non-zero-bin hit if it has expectation less than this value

param.name: zero_bin_mult_expect
param.label: Multiplies expect value of PSMs in the zero-bin during results ordering (set to less than 1 for boosting)

param.name: add_topn_complementary
param.label: Inserts complementary ions corresponding to the top N most intense fragments in each experimental spectrum
param.help: Useful for recovery of modified peptides near C-terminus in open search. 0 disables this option

param.name: min_fragments_modeling
param.label: Minimum number of matched peaks in PSM for inclusion in statistical modeling

param.name: min_matched_fragments
param.label: Minimum number of matched peaks for PSM to be reported
param.help: MSFragger recommends a minimum of 4 for narrow window searching and 6 for open searches

param.name: output_report_topn
param.label: Reports top N PSMs per input spectrum

param.name: output_max_expect
param.label: Suppresses reporting of PSM if top hit has expectation greater than this threshold

param.name: localize_delta_mass
param.label: Include fragment ions mass-shifted by unknown modifications (recommended for open and mass offset searches) (0 for OFF, 1 for ON)

param.name: add_cterm_peptide
param.label: Statically add mass in Da to C-terminal of peptide

param.name: add_nterm_peptide
param.label: Statically add mass in Da to N-terminal of peptide

param.name: add_cterm_protein
param.label: Statically add mass in Da to C-terminal of protein

param.name: add_nterm_protein
param.label: Statically add mass in Da to N-terminal of protein

param.name: add_G_glycine
param.label: Statically add mass to glycine

param.name: add_A_alanine
param.label: Statically add mass to alanine

param.name: add_S_serine
param.label: Statically add mass to serine

param.name: add_P_proline
param.label: Statically add mass to proline

param.name: add_V_valine
param.label: Statically add mass to valine

param.name: add_T_threonine
param.label: Statically add mass to threonine

param.name: add_C_cysteine
param.label: Statically add mass to cysteine

param.name: add_L_leucine
param.label: Statically add mass to leucine

param.name: add_I_isoleucine
param.label: Statically add mass to isoleucine

param.name: add_N_asparagine
param.label: Statically add mass to asparagine

param.name: add_D_aspartic_acid
param.label: Statically add mass to aspartic_acid

param.name: add_Q_glutamine
param.label: Statically add mass to glutamine

param.name: add_K_lysine
param.label: Statically add mass to lysine

param.name: add_E_glutamic_acid
param.label: Statically add mass to glutamic_acid

param.name: add_M_methionine
param.label: Statically add mass to methionine

param.name: add_H_histidine
param.label: Statically add mass to histidine

param.name: add_F_phenylalanine
param.label: Statically add mass to phenylalanine

param.name: add_R_arginine
param.label: Statically add mass to arginine

param.name: add_Y_tyrosine
param.label: Statically add mass to tyrosine

param.name: add_W_tryptophan
param.label: Statically add mass to tryptophan

param.name: unimod
param.label: Fixed modifications in unimod syntax if specific mass is unknown
param.help: e.g. Carbamidomethylation (C). When multiple different masses are given for one aminoacid this parameter (unimod) will have priority (space separated list, in order to allow for spaces in list items surround them by single quotes)

param.name: decoy_string
param.label: String that was appended (or prefixed - see 'decoy_string_position' flag below) to the accessions in the protein database to indicate decoy proteins
param.help: If empty (default), it's determined automatically (checking for common terms, both as prefix and suffix)

param.name: decoy_string_position
param.label: Is the 'decoy_string' prepended (prefix) or appended (suffix) to the protein accession
param.help: (ignored if decoy_string is empty)

param.name: missing_decoy_action
param.label: Action to take if NO peptide was assigned to a decoy protein (which indicates wrong database or decoy string): 'error' (exit with error, no output), 'warn' (exit with success, warning message), 'silent' (no action is taken, not even a warning)

param.name: write_protein_sequence
param.label: If set, the protein sequences are stored as well

param.name: write_protein_description
param.label: If set, the protein description is stored as well

param.name: keep_unreferenced_proteins
param.label: If set, protein hits which are not referenced by any peptide are kept

param.name: unmatched_action
param.label: If peptide sequences cannot be matched to any protein: 1) raise an error; 2) warn (unmatched PepHits will miss target/decoy annotation with downstream problems); 3) remove the hit

param.name: aaa_max
param.label: Maximal number of ambiguous amino acids (AAAs) allowed when matching to a protein database with AAAs
param.help: AAAs are 'B', 'J', 'Z' and 'X'

param.name: mismatches_max
param.label: Maximal number of mismatched (mm) amino acids allowed when matching to a protein database
param.help: The required runtime is exponential in the number of mm's; apply with care. MM's are allowed in addition to AAA's

param.name: IL_equivalent
param.label: Treat the isobaric amino acids isoleucine ('I') and leucine ('L') as equivalent (indistinguishable)
param.help: Also occurrences of 'J' will be treated as 'I' thus avoiding ambiguous matching

param.name: name
param.label: Enzyme which determines valid cleavage sites -
param.help: e.g. trypsin cleaves after lysine (K) or arginine (R), but not before proline (P). Default: deduce from input

param.name: specificity
param.label: Specificity of the enzyme
param.help: Default: deduce from input.. 'full': both internal cleavage sites must match.. 'semi': one of two internal cleavage sites must match.. 'none': allow all peptide hits no matter their context (enzyme is irrelevant)

param.label: Overrides tool-specific checks
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs

data.name: opt_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: opt_out
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "opt_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Peptide Identification with MSFragger. Important note: The Regents of the University of Michigan (“Michigan”) grants us permission to redistribute the MS Fragger application developed by Michigan within the OpenMS Pipeline and make available for use on related service offerings supported by the University of Tubingen and the Center for Integrative Bioinformatics. Per the license agreement the use of the pipeline and associated materials is for academic research, non-commercial or educational purposes. Any commercial use inquiries must be directed to the University of Michigan Technology Transfer Office at techtransfer@umich.edu. All right title and interest in MS Fragger shall remain with the University of Michigan.
For details, please see the supplied license file or https://raw.githubusercontent.com/OpenMS/THIRDPARTY/master/All/MSFragger/License.txt
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/nightly/html/UTILS_MSFraggerAdapter.html
